descriptions.help.en: A free-text description of the Dataset.

access_urls.help.en: URLs that give access to the associated file.

byte_size.help.en: The size of a distributed file in bytes.

checksum.help.en: A mechanism that can be used to verify that the contents of a distribution have not changed.

algorithm.help.en: The algorithm used to calculate the checksum.

value.help.en: The value of the checksum, encoded as a hex binary

conforms_to_schemas.help.en: Established standards to which the distribution conforms.

download_urls.help.en: URLs that are direct links to downloadable files in a given format.

format.help.en: The file format of the distribution.

media_type.help.en: The media type of the distribution as defined by IANA

title.help.en: A name given to the distributed file.

award_title.help.en: The human readable title or name of the award (grant).

funders.help.en: The funder or sponsor of the award (grant) that is funding the resource. This can be either a person or an organization.

organization.help.en: The organization that is the funder or sponsor of the award (grant).

alternate_names.help.en: Alternate organizational names in other languages.

contact_points.help.en: Relevant contact information for the organization.

address_areas.help.en: The name or names of a geographic area or locality that groups a number of addressable objects for addressing purposes, without being an administrative unit. This would typically be part of a city, a neighbourhood or village.

administrative_unit_level_1.help.en: The uppermost administrative unit for the address, almost always a country. The range is a literal, conceptually defined by the INSPIRE Geographical Name data type.

administrative_unit_level_2.help.en: The region of the address, usually a county, state or other such area that typically encompasses several localities. The range is a literal, conceptually defined by the INSPIRE Geographical Name data type.

full_address.help.en: The complete address written as a string, with or without formatting.

locator_designators.help.en: A number or a sequence of characters that uniquely identifies the locator within the relevant scope(s). The full identification of the locator could include one or more locator designators.

locator_names.help.en: Proper noun(s) applied to the real world entity identified by the locator. The locator name could be the name of the property or complex, of the building or part of the building, or it could be the name of a room inside a building.

post_code.help.en: The post code (a.k.a postal code, zip code etc.). Post codes are common elements in many countries' postal address systems.

post_names.help.en: The key postal division of the address, usually the city. (INSPIRE's definition is "One or more names created and maintained for postal purposes to identify a subdivision of addresses and postal delivery points.")

thoroughfares.help.en: The thoroughfare(s) of the address, such as street, road, avenue etc. A thoroughfare is not necessarily a road, it might be a waterway or some other feature.

value.help.en: Value of the identifer within the given identifier scheme. If the value looks like an URL, it must be a resolvable URL.

name.help.en: Official organizational name in its primary language.

person.help.en: The person who is the funder or sponsor of the award (grant).

items.help.en: Affiliations of the person to the organization.

alternate_names.help.en: Alternate organizational names in other languages.

value.help.en: Value of the identifer within the given identifier scheme. If the value looks like an URL, it must be a resolvable URL.

name.help.en: Official organizational name in its primary language.

items.help.en: Relevant contact information for the person.

family_names.help.en: The family names of the person

given_names.help.en: The given names of the person

value.help.en: Value of the identifer within the given identifier scheme. If the value looks like an URL, it must be a resolvable URL.

name.help.en: The name of the person. Should be formatted as "family names separated by space, comma, given names separated by space".

funding_program.help.en: Reference to the specific funding program.

local_identifier.help.en: The code assigned by the funder to a sponsored award (grant).

value.help.en: Value of the identifer within the given identifier scheme. If the value looks like an URL, it must be a resolvable URL.

is_described_by.help.en: Repositories where the dataset is described.

conforms_to_standards.help.en: Established standard to which the metadata record conforms.

date_created.help.en: The date on which the metadata record was created.

dates_updated.help.en: Dates on which the resource was changed.

original_repositories.help.en: Link to the repository from which the metadata were originally stored and curated. Note that this link should go the dataset's landing page, not to the repository home page.

qualified_relations.help.en: Qualified relations (such as, creator of the metadata, not of the dataset)

alternate_names.help.en: Alternate organizational names in other languages.

geometry.help.en: The corresponding geometry for a resource.

relation_type.help.en: Type of the relation between Dataset and related resource.

resource_url.help.en: A URL that points to the resource, preferably containing human-readable information about the resource.

date.help.en: A point or period of time associated with an event in the lifecycle of the resource.

date_information.help.en: Additional information to the date in text form.

title.help.en: A name given to the resource.

type.help.en: A description of the resource. Gets the value from controlled list https://datacite-metadata-schema.readthedocs.io/en/4.6/appendices/appendix-1/resourceTypeGeneral/.

relation_type.label.en: Relation of the location to the dataset

primary_language.help.en: The primary language of the dataset. Might be unfilled if the dataset is language neutral.

provenances.help.en: Statements about the lineage of this dataset.

publication_year.help.en: The year when the item was or will be made publicly available.

qualified_relations.help.en: Relations to agents (such as creators, contributors, publishers)

address_areas.help.en: The name or names of a geographic area or locality that groups a number of addressable objects for addressing purposes, without being an administrative unit. This would typically be part of a city, a neighbourhood or village.

administrative_unit_level_1.help.en: The uppermost administrative unit for the address, almost always a country. The range is a literal, conceptually defined by the INSPIRE Geographical Name data type.

administrative_unit_level_2.help.en: The region of the address, usually a county, state or other such area that typically encompasses several localities. The range is a literal, conceptually defined by the INSPIRE Geographical Name data type.

full_address.help.en: The complete address written as a string, with or without formatting.

locator_designators.help.en: A number or a sequence of characters that uniquely identifies the locator within the relevant scope(s). The full identification of the locator could include one or more locator designators.

locator_names.help.en: Proper noun(s) applied to the real world entity identified by the locator. The locator name could be the name of the property or complex, of the building or part of the building, or it could be the name of a room inside a building.

post_code.help.en: The post code (a.k.a postal code, zip code etc.). Post codes are common elements in many countries' postal address systems.

post_names.help.en: The key postal division of the address, usually the city. (INSPIRE's definition is "One or more names created and maintained for postal purposes to identify a subdivision of addresses and postal delivery points.")

thoroughfares.help.en: The thoroughfare(s) of the address, such as street, road, avenue etc. A thoroughfare is not necessarily a road, it might be a waterway or some other feature.

value.help.en: Value of the identifer within the given identifier scheme. If the value looks like an URL, it must be a resolvable URL.

name.help.en: Official organizational name in its primary language.

items.help.en: Relevant contact information for the person.

administrative_unit_level_2.help.en: The region of the address, usually a county, state or other such area that typically encompasses several localities. The range is a literal, conceptually defined by the INSPIRE Geographical Name data type.

post_names.help.en: The key postal division of the address, usually the city. (INSPIRE's definition is "One or more names created and maintained for postal purposes to identify a subdivision of addresses and postal delivery points.")

thoroughfares.help.en: The thoroughfare(s) of the address, such as street, road, avenue etc. A thoroughfare is not necessarily a road, it might be a waterway or some other feature.

family_names.help.en: The family names of the person

given_names.help.en: The given names of the person

value.help.en: Value of the identifer within the given identifier scheme. If the value looks like an URL, it must be a resolvable URL.

name.help.en: The name of the person. Should be formatted as "family names separated by space, comma, given names separated by space".

relation_type.help.en: Type of the relation between Dataset and related resource.

resource_url.help.en: A URL that points to the resource, preferably containing human-readable information about the resource.

date.help.en: A point or period of time associated with an event in the lifecycle of the resource.

date_information.help.en: Additional information to the date in text form.

title.help.en: A name given to the resource.

type.help.en: A description of the resource. Gets the value from controlled list https://datacite-metadata-schema.readthedocs.io/en/4.6/appendices/appendix-1/resourceTypeGeneral/.

resource_type.help.en: Type of the resource from a controlled vocabulary

classification_code.help.en: The classification code used for the subject term in the subject scheme.

scheme.help.en: A controlled vocabulary or classification scheme used to describe the subject of a resource. Concepts have a unique id within the subject scheme.

access_rights.help.en: Information about who access the resource or an indication of its security status.

contacts.help.en: Contact person/organization for the further details about the terms of use.

alternate_names.help.en: Alternate organizational names in other languages.

contact_points.help.en: Relevant contact information for the organization.

items.help.en: Descriptive text on details of rights and licensing.

license.help.en: Information about licensing details of the resource.

date.help.en: A point or period of time associated with an event in the lifecycle of the resource.

date_information.help.en: Additional information to the date in text form.

title.help.en: A name given to the resource.

versions.help.en: The version indicator (name or identifier) of a resource.
